params.text:
Telephone

Taking a Message

Language in Action

• Ask for the Subject of the Message
  • Take Down all Necessary Information
  • Communicate Next Steps
Telephone: Introduction

In today’s module, you will learn how to effectively take messages on the phone, including:

You'll learn how to:

1. Effectively asking for the subject of the call

  2. Noting down all the necessary information in the message

  3. Clearly communicating the next steps to your interlocuter
Ask For The Subject Of The Message: Flashcards

dialogs.text: Who can I say is calling, please? And can I ask the nature of your call?
dialogs.answer: A professional way to inquire about the caller's identity and the reason for their call.

dialogs.text:
May I take a message for [name of person you're taking the message for]?
Would you like to leave a brief message about what it's regarding?
dialogs.answer: Use this after informing the caller that the person they are trying to reach is unavailable.

dialogs.text:
This is [your name] taking a message for [name of person you're taking the message for].
Can I get your name and the reason for your call?
dialogs.answer: Introduce yourself, mention you're taking a message, and ask for the caller's name and reason for calling.

metadata.title: Asking For And Verifying Information Dialogue Cards

params.text: Please read the following flashcards for useful phrases you can use when asking for the subject of a telephone call:
Ask For The Subject Of The Message: Listening & Quiz
Abigail:
Please listen to the following conversation and answer the questions below:

params.audioNotSupported: Your browser does not support this audio

params.text: Micah:

choices.question: Question 1 of 3: Why is Micah calling Mr. Jones?
answers:
To ask Mr. Jones a question about a delivery. 

To leave a birthday message for Mr. Jones. 

To inform Mr. Jones about a meeting they have scheduled.

choices.question: Question 2 of 3: What does Abigail ask Micah to do?
answers:
Briefly explain the reason for his call.

Hang up and leave a voicemail message. 

Call back later when Mr. Jones is available.

choices.question: Question 3 of 3: What does Micah want to confirm with Mr. Jones?
answers:
Whether Mr. Jones is available today for the delivery. 

Mr. Jones' home address for the delivery. 

The total cost of the delivery for Mr. Jones.

l10n.a11yShowSolution: Show the solution. The task will be marked with its correct solution.
l10n.a11yRetry: Retry the task. Reset all responses and start the task over again.

params.text: Dialogue Text:

Abigail: Hello, this is Abigail speaking. How can I help you today?

Micah: Hi there, I’m calling for Mr Jones. May I leave a message if he's unavailable?

Abigail: Certainly. Would you like to leave a brief message about what it's regarding?

Micah: Yes, please. I’m calling from Brown's Delivery. We were supposed to schedule a delivery for Mr Jones today, but I wanted to confirm the time that works best for him.

Abigail: Alright, thanks for letting me know. I'll be sure to pass that message on to Mr Jones.
Ask For The Subject Of The Message: Exercise
Please complete the missing words to form useful phrases: nature, message, calling, reason, leave, get, taking

questions:
May I take a *message* for Ms. Johnson? 
Would you like to *leave* a brief message about what it's regarding?
This is David *taking* a message for Mr. Lee. 
Can I *get* your name and the *reason* for your call?
Who can I say is *calling*, please? And can I ask the *nature* of your call?

metadata.title: Ask For The Subject Of The Message Fill in the Blanks

params.text: Take Down All Necessary Information: Flashcards

dialogs.text: Can I get your name, please? And how can I spell that?
dialogs.answer: Politely ask for the caller's name and confirm the spelling to ensure accuracy.

dialogs.text: Is there a phone number where I can reach you in case I need to get in touch?
dialogs.answer: Ask for the caller's contact information in case you need to reach them later.

dialogs.text: Can you hold for a moment while I grab a pen and paper?
dialogs.answer: Excuse yourself politely to get the materials you need to take the message.

dialogs.text: Do you have a preferred time for [name of person you're taking the message for] to return your call?
dialogs.answer: If appropriate, inquire about the caller's preferred timeframe for a return call.

dialogs.text: Is there anything else I can help you with today?
dialogs.answer: After taking the message, see if the caller has any other questions or requests.

Question 2 of 3: Is there a _______ number where I can reach you in case I need to get in touch?

params.text: Take Down All Necessary Information: Quiz
Please answer the following questions to complete the sentences:
Communicate Next Steps: Flashcards

dialogs.text: Okay, let me just read back what I have here to confirm: [Summarize the message briefly].
dialogs.answer: Briefly repeat the key details of the message to ensure you understood correctly.

dialogs.text: Mr. Jones will be sure to get your message when he returns to the office later today.
dialogs.answer: Inform the caller when the person they are trying to reach will likely receive the message.

dialogs.text: Is there anything else I can help you with today?
dialogs.answer: After summarizing and next steps, see if the caller has any other questions.

dialogs.text: Thank you for your call! Have a wonderful day!
dialogs.answer: Thank the caller for their time and end the conversation on a positive note.

dialogs.text: You're welcome to leave another message if you don't reach [name of person] today.
dialogs.answer: Let the caller know they can leave another message if needed.

params.text: Please review the following flashcards to see useful sentences for communicating the next steps after taking a message on the phone:
Communicate Next Steps: Listening & Quiz
Anthony:
Please listen to the following telephone conversation and answer the questions below:

params.audioNotSupported: Your browser does not support this audio

params.text: Bryan:

choices.question: Question 1 of 3: Why is Anthony calling Micah?
answers:
To confirm a meeting time for a design project. 

To leave a birthday message. 

To ask Micah a question about a recent delivery.

choices.question: Question 2 of 3: What does Bryan offer to do for Anthony?
answers:
Take a message for Micah.

Transfer him directly to Micah. 

Ask Anthony to call back later.

choices.question: Question 3 of 3: What does Anthony suggest for the meeting time with Micah?
answers:
He is flexible and can adjust the 2 pm time if needed. 

He is only available to meet in the morning. 

He needs to confirm the meeting but doesn't mention a specific time.

l10n.a11yShowSolution: Show the solution. The task will be marked with its correct solution.
l10n.a11yRetry: Retry the task. Reset all responses and start the task over again.

params.text: Dialogue Text:

Bryan: Hello, this is Bryan speaking. How can I help you today?

Anthony: Hi there, this is Anthony calling for John and I'm returning his call about a design project.

Bryan: Ah, I see. He is currently in a meeting, but I can take a message for him. Would you like to leave a brief message?

Anthony: Yes, please. Can you tell him that Silverwood Design called and wanted to confirm our meeting time for tomorrow afternoon? We were thinking 2 pm, but I'm flexible if that doesn't work for him.

Bryan: Okay, let me just read back what I have here to confirm: This is a message from Silverwood Design. He wants to confirm the meeting time for tomorrow afternoon at 2 pm, but he's flexible if that doesn't work. Is that correct?

Anthony: Perfect, that sounds great.

Bryan: Great! He will get to your message when he returns to the office. Is there anything else I can help you with today?

Anthony: No, that's all for now. Thank you for your time!
Communicate Next Steps: Exercise

params.text: Module Summary Quiz
Choose the BEST answer for each question:

choices.question: Question 1 of 6: When a caller asks for someone who is unavailable, you can say:
answers:
"May I take a message for [name of person], and can I ask the nature of your call?" 

"No problem, I can take a message for them." 

"Let me know if there's anything else I can do for you today."

choices.question: Question 2 of 6: While taking a message, it's important to:
answers:
Briefly summarize the message for the caller to confirm accuracy. 

Write down everything the caller says, word for word. 

Interrupt the caller if you need to clarify something.

choices.question: Question 3 of 6: When asking for the caller's contact information, you can say:
answers:
"Is there a phone number where I can reach you in case I need to get in touch?"

"Do you have a phone number on file with us?" 

​​​​​​"Can you spell your name for me?"

choices.question: Question 4 of 6: After summarizing the message for the caller, you should:
answers:
Let them know how the person they are trying to reach will likely get the message. 

Immediately thank them for the call and end the conversation. 

Ask them to call back again if they don't hear back within an hour.

choices.question: Question 5 of 6: An appropriate way to offer the caller further assistance is to say:
answers:
Let them know how the person they are trying to reach will likely get the message.

Immediately thank them for the call and end the conversation. 

Ask them to call back again if they don't hear back within an hour.

choices.question: Question 6 of 6: If the person the caller is trying to reach is unavailable, you can let the caller know they can:
answers:
You're welcome to leave another message if you don't reach them today.

Try calling back in a few minutes. 

Send an email instead, as they don't check voicemails often.
